snippet: The government said it saw a chance for peace in eastern Ukraine after word that the two leaders and European Union officials would meet next week.
abstract: Ukrainian government says it sees chance for peaceful settlement with Russia after announcement that Pres Vladimir V Putin will meet with his Ukrainian counterpart, Petro O Poroshenko and European Union leaders; possibility arises even as Ukrainian forces push deeper into territory controlled by pro-Russian rebels, fighting street battles in the besieged city of Luhansk and pressuring the outer defenses of Donetsk.

byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Andrew Higgins reported from Kiev, and Andrew E. Kramer from Donetsk, Ukraine. Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: The government said it saw a chance for peace in eastern Ukraine after word that the two leaders and European Union officials would meet next week.

headline.main: Ukrainian and Russian Leaders Will Meet as Rebels Continue to Falter
headline.print_headline: Ukrainian and Russian Leaders Will Meet as Rebels Continue to Falter
